Tyler Kung

For 2019, I wanted to redesign my website. The old one was limited, and I didn't feel like it was a good representation of myself and my capabilities.

I needed my portfolio to serve as a better medium for my projects, and I also wanted it to look different. I figured I had a chance here with no boss, no designers, and no one telling me which way to build this site. I wanted it to be mine and I wanted it to kick ass.

Requirements

  • Have Project pages
  • Be able to support multiple pages (templating)
  • Utilize an initial home page load animation

Technology

I decided to use HandlebarsJS to handle the basic templating. SCSS for CSS preprocessing and VueJS on the front end. Used Gulp to build and compile everything into one directory and hosted my site on Netlify, which syncs and deploys from my Github repository.

Previous Portfolio

V1 Resume

2018

Very basic, single page portfolio which was basically an extension of my resume.
